text: neighbours rivals often enemies before
the Act of Union there was England and
there was Scotland as the age of empire
dawned both nations set sail to conquer
the world England found fertile
territory in Virginia but Scotland's
imperial ambitions died after an
ill-fated colonial adventure in Panama
after its failure in the New World
Scotland turned to the old enemy and the
union was born although Scotland entered
into the union from a position of
weakness the two nations united as
equals and the United Kingdom went on to
dominate the globe the British Empire
turned the map pink and everywhere the
British Empire went Scots were in the
vanguard in india by 1792 Scots made up
one in nine civil servants and one in
three army officers seven of India's 12
viceroys were Scottish Glasgow built the
ships that ruled the waves were
Britannia but as the Imperial tide
turned and as Britain's colonies one by
one sought independence some in Scotland
also began to question their continued
membership of the union far from seeing
themselves as fellow colonialists they
felt themselves to be living in
England's closest colony by journey its
lot with England Scotland created the
idea of the United Kingdom if Scots vote
YES on Thursday without the tether of
the original Act of Union could other
parts of the British Isles feel their
ties to the union also begin to loosen
